name: Green Mountain Inn

reviews.text: While traveling on business in Waterbury decided to try something different with local flavor. Just a quick 15 min drive down the mountain to my destination. Great decision! Clean room with very comfy bed. Not too hot or cold and drafty. The breakfast buffet is just right. You don't find better service in a any 'touristy' town. Check out the attached Whip restaurant and bar for a bite and or a cocktail. Again, Great service. LOVED the Green Mountain Coffee and Keurig brewer in the room. Look forward to returning:)
reviews.title: EXCELLENT - Comfortable, friendly, cozy, convenient.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have stayed at this hotel for our anniversary several times over the past 10 years and have never been disappointed. The inn and it's up keep and quality have gone up every year. The staff is friendly and professional, the location is out of a post card and we always wish we could have stayed longer.
reviews.title: Small town picturesque Inn with world class service and quality

reviews.text: We have been gueats of the Green Mountain Inn,Stowe, Vermont for about the last 10 years. Each time seems better than the last. This visit my husband and I took our 3 daughters, son-in-law and 2 grandchildren (13 yrs and 10 yrs). The Inn is immaculate, the staff accomodating and pleasant, the food delicious! Our package included a complimentary continental breakfast which was wonderful! Our dinner at the Whip Bar was reasonably priced and enough varied choices for even the vegetarians among us.
reviews.title: Excellent experience, as usual surpassing our expectaions!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The outdoor pool was a delight to our 10 yr. old grandson! The Inn was decked out for Christmas and beautiful! I cannot imagine a more suitable place to enjoy time away!
reviews.title: A wonderful Romantic Getaway Destination

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My Husband and I first stayed at the Green Mountain Inn on our Wedding night in July 2007. Since then we try and go back for a romantic getaway every two or three months. The rooms are beautifully decorated, very clean and quiet and have wonderful amenities. We always book a room with a fire and Jacuzzi tub. We make dinner at the Whip part of our evening plans. We always get great service and wonderful food - the Potatoe Dumplings and French Martinis were this trip's favorites. Don't forget to pack a bathing suit so you can enjoy the wonderful outdoor pool. We love taking a swim in the evening when it is snowing out and then enjoying the hot tub!
reviews.title: Such a Magical Place!

reviews.text: The Green Mountain Inn is one of the very special things in Stowe, VT. Everything in the Inn was absolutely perfect and we would return there in a second! I've never seen staff so helpful and so happy to see us. They gave us maps of the area and recommendations for restaurants around the hotel. We ended up going at The Whip, which was marvelous, albeit a little bit pricy.
reviews.title: Loved it!
Wish we stayed longer
reviews.text: The hotel has this unique historical charm. It seems like you are staying in someone's home... And the bed was gorgeous!

reviews.title: Quaint and picturesque hotel
reviews.text: We also loved the hot cider with cookies in the afternoon... A special touch that makes it all worthwhile!

reviews.title: Nice place, great rooms
reviews.text: My husband and I went up to Stowe's Green Mountain Inn the weekend of Dec 2nd and it was more then we could have hopped for. I planned the trip for his b-day and was hoping for Romantic, fun place. We found it!! The place was quaint, clean, and Very Friendly. It's settled in the middle of everything. You can walk to all the local restaurants, bakery's, bars and shops. The bartender Jamie was a Gem. He and one of the cooks soon befriended us and made for a delightful visit. The food at the Whip bar was wonderful, and breakfast (though on the pricey side) was all home made breads and sweets along with a hearty warm breakfast. Worth the money.
We can't wait to go back!!!
reviews.title: Perfect Place In Stowe

reviews.text: We went to the Green Mountain Inn as a way of extending our ski vacation at Stowe. We stayed two nights. Simply put, the Green Mountain Inn is the best Inn we have ever stayed at. Too often with Inns near ski areas, descriptions of luxury, comfort, and amenities bear little relation to reality. Green Mountain Inn defies this common experience.
reviews.title: Finally a New England Inn Done Right!
romantic
reviews.text: Our family of three (2 adults and one 5 year old boy) stayed in a deluxe family suite. The room was in a separate building dehind the main Inn. It was immaculately clean, beautifully decorated with high ceilings, crown moulding, beautiful built cabinentry, a beautiful bathroom, lovely large new Jacuzzi tub and gas fireplace. The building also provided a lovely lobby/living room with a fireplace (always lit in the evening) and a computer with high speed internet for guest usage.

reviews.title: Lovely place, lovely people
reviews.text: The food at the Inn was also very nice. The breakfast was particulary wonderful. The cold buffet provided an assortmant of fresh pastries and breads, perfectly ripe fruit, as well as hard boiled eggs. In addition (we always opted for this) another table proved a wonderful selection of hot foods, which each day provided two egg choices, two meat choices and one selection of either pancakes or french toast. All of which was scrumptious. A server came each morning, promptly delivering the beverages of our choice. It was quick and a delicious was to start off a day of skiing. (My normally fincky five year old loved the breakfast, and commented "they have everyting I like here" as he consumed more fruit than I ever expected, as well as eggs and pancakes.)

reviews.title: it must be wonderful in season
reviews.text: I also was fortunate to be able to use the massage services. My massage was wonderful, and very fairly priced.

Also significant was the helpfulness of the front desk. We were greeted with friendly professionalism, and the service, in terms of booking resturants and and other services, was efficient and prompt -- guest follow up was never needed -- things were done right the first time (unfortunately an all too uncommon occurance with New England Inns).
reviews.title: Stowe is adorable!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was amazing. There was a gas fireplace and a two-person jacuzzi in the room. The bed was unbelievably comfortable. Green Mountain Inn offers just about every amenity from massage to complementary tea and cookies in the afternoon. The town of Stowe is a fun place, with plenty of shops and places to explore. We enjoyed a wonderful dinner at The Whip, which is located at the Inn. Service was good, all the staff we encountered were friendly and helpful. All in all, it was the perfect luxurious and romantic escape. Can't wait to go back!
reviews.title: An Amazing Inn

reviews.text: We stayed in the Pinnacle 2 bedrrom suite at the Green Mountain inn. It was over a busy fall weekend (Oktoberfest was on ) and despite it being busy we had a lovely relaxing stay. Welcoming and efficient reception staff got us registered and on our way to our suite in no time. We had to go up a flight of stairs to our suite but did not have to touch our luggage as this was brought up for us. All 6 suitcases as we were on a extended vacation!! The suite had a homely and cozy feel and yet was very spacious. It had a washer and dryer and place for snowy boots and skis just inside the front door. There was an open plan full kitchen, huge dining table and cushioned bench and chairs surrounding it. There was a gas fireplace in the lounge area and a twin bedroom and seperate shower room. Up a further flight of stairs was the master suite with kingsize bed and flat screen tv and another gas fire. There was also a huge jacuzzi bath with another tv you could watch whilst in the jacuzzi. A seperate room contained the wc and washbasin and vanity. There were lovely homely quilts on all beds and the whole place was very clean. We immediately felt at home and relaxed. The Whip bar and restaurant was extremely busy with a long queue of people waiting so we were glad we had pre booked a table. The food and service was excellent and I would highly recommend eating here. The hotel staff were very helpful as it was my dad's birthday during our stay and I asked them to organise a birthday cake for him with little notice. This they did and delivered it to our suite on his birthday.
reviews.title: Warm and welcoming. Popular restaurant, great food

reviews.text: A fantastic place to stay in this lovely town of Stowe.
reviews.title: The Complete Package

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Green Mountain Inn is the complete package. Wonderful service, elegant rooms (we had a luxury room with a fireplace and a jacuzzi tub) and fabulous dining in The Whip restaurant. Its location in the village of Stowe is convenient and allows for easy access to the rec path. We have been staying here for years and always look forward to returning.
reviews.title: Small room, unhelpful staff - a very disappointing stay.

reviews.text: This was the 3rd Hotel in our visit to the USA - the accomodation was nowhere near the standard we had experienced in the previous venues.The room was small, the bathroom so tiny you could hardly move & despite notifying them before booking that we had a disabled person in the party - no allowance was made for this in the distance the room was from the lift & up steps.On complaining we were advised that we could 'upgrade' at the cost of $100 a night as all the 'standard' rooms were booked.Where was the Customer Service in this?
reviews.title: Great rooms, great spot

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and i spent a romatic weekened here, we stayed in a luxury suite in the mansfield house with whirlpool tub and fireplace in room. king bed and comfy bathrobes included. the main dinning area served breakfast and tea and cookies in afternoon, very good baked goods. the whip restaurant was perfect, excellant food and atmosphere. the staff was friendly and helpful. the inn is located downtown in the heart of stowe, shopping in walking distance as well as a walking path close by. we would definately go back.
reviews.title: PERFECT ROMANTIC WEEKEND GETAWAY........

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I don't know what I can say about the Green Mountain Inn that hasn't already been said, and probably said better. I will say that all the reviews are accurate, this is a spectacular hotel. We stayed in one of the luxury suites in the Mansfield House, and loved everything about the room. It was spotless, comfortable, and had every amenity we could ask for.
reviews.title: Spectacular

reviews.text: Like some other reviewers have mentioned, we were really struck by how quiet it was. The parking lot was full, but we didn't hear any noise whatsoever in the building.
reviews.title: A college visit to remember

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff is terrific as well, friendly and helpful. We struck up a conversation during afternoon tea with a couple who told us they have stayed at several properties in Stowe, but that they are repeat visitors to the Green Mountain . . . we can definitely see why.
reviews.title: Perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our first trip to Stowe, and while it's a very pretty little town, what really made it a great visit for us was the hotel. In fact, this is the first time I can remember ever returning from a vacation and talking more about the hotel than anything else . . . we will be back for sure.
reviews.title: Great stay, but...

reviews.text: The Green Mountain Inn is a lovely hotel in downtown Stowe, Vermont. The staff is very helpful and kind. Unlike many hotels they seemed willing and ready to help with any request. The Inn has a great bar and rest. which provide that laid back rustic vermont feel that many people hope for when they visit. I didnt get to try the breakfast buffet but from what I saw it looked outstanding.
reviews.title: GREAT..but choose room carefully.

reviews.text: We were a party of 4 and we got two standard rooms , one with a king bed and one with doubles. The double room had an outdoor entrance off the parking lot. It was plenty big enough and had a nice balcony over- looking the pool. The furnishings were nice, with a part rustic/part victorian feel. The bathroom was gorgeous with all the needed amenities. For the price it was more then to be expected from this room. My friends were in the king room, located within the main hotel. However, the room was at the end of what seemed like a maze. Their room was decorated slightly nicer with a canopy bed and a bookcase, but it was MUCH smaller then the double room and had a slightly clausterphoic feel. The bathroom was about the half the size of our bathroom. The room was also very hot and stuffy. I would probably have chosen my double room over the king even if traveling alone. I asked the front desk if I could check some of the other rooms out for my next stay . The luxury rooms looked outstanding, next time I might pay extra to try one out. The pool and health club area far exeeded my expectations for a small inn like this. They had a very large and well equipped work out room, a small but fully stocked locker room, and a very nice hot tub and sauna area. The outdoor pool was also a nice touch, they had it heated to about 90-95 degrees. I dont know if I would want to go in it on a really cold winter day, but for March it was perfect. All in all I would highly recd. this hotel, just carefully choose the type of room you want, because they are very differant in nature. If you perfer space over furnishings try a luxury room, or the standard double rooms off the parking lot.
reviews.title: Best in the area

reviews.text: I booked The Green Mountain Inn on line- not knowing what to expect. It turned out to be even nicer than I expected. Very friendly and helpful service, beautiful rooms,(we chose one with a fireplace and jacuzzi in the room) and nice bar/resturant area. We loved that you could walk to some great resturants/shops/galleries and your'e 10 minutes to the slopes.
reviews.title: Fantastic!
Loved the Inn, but . . . . .
reviews.text: The decor is charming thru out. Just beautiful.

reviews.title: Quaint LITTLE inn with GREAT food
reviews.text: We would highly recommend it and would definitely stay there again. After visiting Stowe, and seeing the other accomodations in the area, I believe The Green Mountain Inn is the nicest.
We recently returned from a 3-day midweek stay (Jan 10-13th) at the Green Mountain Inn. While I have skiied at Stowe several times in the past, I have never stayed at the Green Mountain Inn.
reviews.title: An Underachiever
Quaint little inn close to skiing and great food
reviews.text: We booked a Ski and Stay package through the hotel for which we paid roughly $518. It included three nights lodging and two, two-day lift tickets valid at Stowe. Purchasing two, two-day lift tickets on your own (at the ticket counter on the mountain) runs $102/person or $204 total during the "Prime" season when we visited.

Thus, you could argue that we paid a scant $304 for our hotel stay or roughly $101/night for our room. At that rate, I really shouldn't have much to complain about. Even the lowly Commodores Inn down the road will cost you $100/night and the Green Mountain Inn is a clear step up from the Commodores.
reviews.title: We loved the Green Mountain Inn

reviews.text: However, we were surprised to find a room which was much smaller than we expected upon walking into room 239, which is located at the end of a labyrythine walk through narrow hallways on the second floor of the main house.
reviews.title: When it comes to Vermont vacationing, this place is the real deal!

reviews.text: The room was clean, but clearly worn. The horizontal blinds covering the windows were more than tattered with individual blinds bent and folded and pointing in all sorts of directions. The television was quite small, and the front base of the console was cracked with its piece missing. The room had an odd odor, which we suspected resulted from an overexuberant use of Oust (or similar) overlying the musty ambient air. The fan in the bathroom was very loud and chattery and the bathroom must have been on a slight slant, since the shower doors kept sliding to one end leaving half the shower open and water spraying everywhere (we finally solved this by wedging a facecloth between the doors to prevent them from sliding).
reviews.title: Stayed in the Mansfield House for our honeymoon...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived at this hotel on Christmas Eve to a warm welcome, we arrived early and our room was ready for us we had a deluxe king room. We were thrilled with the room it was quite large with a gas coal effect fire which was working great . the canopy bed was great if a little firm but i cant complain.
reviews.title: Charming

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The atmosphere in the hotel was great it was very festive and jolly. The bar & reasturant was al ways full and i think its a popular place to eat. However when we arrived we were to late to book a table for Christmas day. It was our fault as the hotel did email us a good few weks before we left home advising us that this would be the case so we should book early. The reception staff went out of their way to get us into the stowe inn for christmas day ( another review).
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel

reviews.text: The outside pool area was heated for a few hours each day and this was great even though the outside temperature was -8 it was a great pleasure swimming at dusk in the snow surrounded pool.
reviews.title: Beautifull early 19th century country Inn set in excellent Stowe, VT

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a wonderful time at the inn and if we ever return to Stowe would stay again. We loved the Christmas decorations along with the Christmas tree, all made the inn look very festive. my husband used the gym area and he says it was great for a small hotel however the sauna could have been a little hotter!
reviews.title: Very Disappointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spent 4 nights at the Green Mountain Inn after Christmas and into New Year's. My girlfriend loved all of the decorations as well as the complimentary afternoon tea and cookies. Breakfast was excellent. We enjoyed the most delicious breads and scones I think I have ever had. The baker at the inn clearly is excellent at what they do. Dinner at the Whip was also delicious. Had a great time skiing and also some great meals at Gracie's, Trapp and Piecasso. We would highly recommend the hotel. Only downside was the somewhat spotty housekeeping service; came a little late and could have been more generous with soaps and refills. Having stayed in an annex room also experienced some noise from guests who were using the pool; good thing it closes at 9 at night. Overall excellent and will gladly return.
reviews.title: Once Again Excellent

description: A beautifully restored historic inn blending classic country charm and modern amenities in the heart of Stowe village. Offering over 100 quaint rooms, suites, townhouses and apartments, many with fireplaces and Jacuzzis. Enjoy sumptuous cuisine in two dining rooms - including the famous Whip Bar & Grill with outdoor terrace. Heated outdoor pool, afternoon tea & cookies, health club with Jacuzzi, sauna and massage.
